A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This Movie is enjoyable\, but flawed. When i watched it\, I thought it was good. But it could be improved.
First\, we should've been some small hint on Snoke's backstory. This isn't a major point\, but this would've been a bigger shock.
Second\, and this is one big bug bear even I have\, Finn was a wasted character. I would've loved to have seen more connections of his First Order past\, which has been glossed over. The Cantobyte act was unnecessary.
Third\, Rey. This movie has enforced her as a Mary Sue character. However\, I think that she being related to a character in the originals would make her even more Mary Sue. I think her character's immense ability to use the force and skills need to be sussed out cleverly.
Last\, the Resistance fleeing the First order. It's not a bad scene\, but it didn't make sense how that Admiral woman didn't tell anyone her plan (if she had a plan\, which I think she didn't). If Admiral Ackbar was in that place\, it would've been fitting.
However\, there are good things. The acting and visuals were stunning and Kylo Ren has a villain arc which is amazing. I think the change in Luke Skywalker's character is realistic and was different from just having him the same way. In the next movie\, I would like to see it tie everything together and try not to waste all the assets which it could've been using.
I don't think it's a bad movie\, it's just flawed. And it's sad to see a fanbase so divided over one movie.
